title: Naked man used bike wheel to attack stranger in the street
text:
King’s street fight was caught on camera (Picture: Deadline News)

A man has been jailed for a year after he was filmed fighting in the street wearing nothing but his socks.

Jason King, 27, went viral when he was caught bursting out of his flat naked from the waist down before throwing off his t-shirt while fighting.

He used a bicycle wheel as a weapon which he hurled towards a man who had confronted him at the door of his flat in Renfrew, near Glasgow.

King admitted a a breach of the Criminal Justice and Licensing Act ‘by behaving in a threatening or abusive manner which was likely to cause a reasonable person to suffer fear or alarm.’

Paisley Sheriff Court said King entered not guilty pleas to three other charges, which were accepted.

The video of the incident – which was posted to Facebook with the caption ‘Just another night in the Royal Burgh of Renfrew’ – racked tens of thousands of views in the hours afterwards.

It showed King brawling with a man in all black before attempting to shove a woman holding a small red bag over in the street.

The woman – seen with white hair – managed to take King’s fleece off him during the tussle.

The clip ended with King running back to his flats and a man’s voice heard saying: ‘Interesting Monday night.’

At the time, one person commented: ‘Some things you can’t unsee.’
